PID Tuner API¶

pid_tuner.cli.plot(log: str = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, axes: ~typing.List[str] = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, overlay_throttle: bool = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, out_dir: str = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>)¶

Generate PID vs gyro and D-term zoom plots.

pid_tuner.cli.spikes_cmd(log: str = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, axes: ~typing.List[str] = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, window: int = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, threshold: float = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, min_mag: float = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, time_window: str = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, page: int = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, per_page: int = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>, out_dir: str = <typer.models.OptionInfo object>)¶

Detect spikes, save full CSVs, and page through details.

pid_tuner.plotter.detect_spikes(df, axis='roll', window=50, threshold_factor=2.0)¶

Return a DataFrame of all D-term spikes for the given axis. Each row has: axis, time_us, d_value (D-term), std_value (rolling std).

pid_tuner.stats.spike_summary(log: str, axes: list[str], window: int, threshold: float, out_dir: str | None = None)¶
Summarize D-term spikes across axes:

  • total time

  • count, rate, avg/max |D|

  • avg throttle (if available)

Renders a rich table to the console.
